intro: Steiractinia helianthoides, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces numerous tiny seeds in a composite flower head. Steiractinia helianthoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
